data.description: Job OverviewAre you passionate about people data and turning insights into action? Our HR Data Analytics Internship gives you hands-on experience building dashboards, analyzing trends, and improving data quality that powers strategic HR decisions. As an intern, you’ll partner with Talent Acquisition, HR Operations, and Business Partners to explore workforce, recruiting, and engagement data—translating numbers into clear, compelling stories for leaders. You’ll learn the analytics toolkit (Excel/SQL/BI), the HR data landscape (HRIS/ATS), and the practices that keep employee data accurate, secure, and useful. Interested? Apply today!What you will be doing:Prepare and/or present written, oral, and electronic proposals to management staff.Develop instructional material by identifying gaps in knowledge, skills, and attitudes of employees and analyzing learning needs.Participate in a variety of professional development activities providing practical experience in the application of development skills toward the solution of business problems.Participate in project work, including Onboarding; develop procedures, perform financial, operational, or business analysis, or develop/evaluate performance measures.Compile learning metrics; assist in forecasting training activity.What you need:Must be an active student in a bachelor's degree program bachelor’s degree program with an emphasis in Human Resources, Business/Data Analytics, Information Systems, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.18 years of age or older.What we desire:Current, cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher from one of the following universities (University of North Texas, University of Texas at Arlington, University of Texas at Dallas, Paul Quinn College, or University of Oklahoma).We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas for this position at this time.About UsWe are Dallas Fort Worth International (DFW) Airport-one of the most successful airports in the world by any definition. We are recognized for our innovation, leadership, drive for excellence and talented employees.Our success is made possible because of the diverse talents of over 2,100 employees who champion our mission of providing an exceptional airport experience to our customers and connect our community to the world. We are looking for the best talent to join us and help reimagine what an airport can be.Bring your talents to DFW. Live and work with purpose.
requirements: Must be an active student in a bachelor's degree program bachelor’s degree program with an emphasis in Human Resources, Business/Data Analytics, Information Systems, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
responsibilities: Develop instructional material by identifying gaps in knowledge, skills, and attitudes of employees and analyzing learning needs.
Participate in a variety of professional development activities providing practical experience in the application of development skills toward the solution of business problems.
Participate in project work, including Onboarding; develop procedures, perform financial, operational, or business analysis, or develop/evaluate performance measures.
